title: Nvidia Weekly News Summary
body:
**Financial Performance:**

- **Q1 Fiscal 2026 Results:** Nvidia reported revenue of $44.1 billion for the first quarter ended April 27, 2025, marking a 12% increase from the previous quarter and a 69% rise year-over-year. Data Center revenue reached $39.1 billion, up 10% sequentially and 73% annually. ([investor.nvidia.com](https://investor.nvidia.com/news/press-release-details/2025/NVIDIA-Announces-Financial-Results-for-First-Quarter-Fiscal-2026/default.aspx?utm_source=openai))

- **Impact of Export Controls:** On April 9, 2025, the U.S. government imposed licensing requirements for Nvidia's H20 products destined for China. This led to a $4.5 billion charge in Q1 fiscal 2026 due to excess inventory and purchase obligations, as demand for H20 products declined. ([investor.nvidia.com](https://investor.nvidia.com/news/press-release-details/2025/NVIDIA-Announces-Financial-Results-for-First-Quarter-Fiscal-2026/default.aspx?utm_source=openai))

**Product Developments:**

- **Blackwell NVL72 AI Supercomputer:** Nvidia's Blackwell NVL72 AI supercomputer is now in full-scale production across system makers and cloud service providers. CEO Jensen Huang highlighted the strong global demand for Nvidia's AI infrastructure, noting a tenfold increase in AI inference token generation over the past year. ([investor.nvidia.com](https://investor.nvidia.com/news/press-release-details/2025/NVIDIA-Announces-Financial-Results-for-First-Quarter-Fiscal-2026/default.aspx?utm_source=openai))

**Market Performance:**

- **Stock Price Movement:** As of December 19, 2025, Nvidia's stock (NASDAQ: NVDA) closed at $180.99, reflecting a 3.85% increase from the previous close. The stock reached an intraday high of $181.25 and a low of $175.57.

- **Market Capitalization Milestone:** In early July 2025, Nvidia's market capitalization surpassed $4 trillion, making it the first chipmaker and third company overall to achieve this valuation, joining Apple and Microsoft. ([tradingnews.com](https://www.tradingnews.com/news/nvidia-smashes-4-trillion-usd-can-nvda-keep-climbing-after-ai-fuled-rally?utm_source=openai))

**Regulatory Developments:**

- **Potential Resumption of H200 Chip Sales to China:** Former U.S. President Donald Trump indicated the possibility of allowing Nvidia to resume sales of its H200 AI chips to China, which were previously restricted under U.S. export controls. This announcement led to a 1.7% increase in Nvidia's share price on December 8, 2025. ([moneyweek.com](https://moneyweek.com/investments/nvidia-share-price?utm_source=openai))

key_dates.title: End of Q1 Fiscal 2026
key_dates.importance_for_price: Nvidia reported strong financial results for Q1 Fiscal 2026, with significant revenue growth, positively impacting stock performance.

key_dates.title: U.S. Export Controls on H20 Products
key_dates.importance_for_price: The U.S. government's licensing requirements for H20 products led to a substantial financial charge for Nvidia, affecting investor sentiment.

key_dates.title: Market Capitalization Surpasses $4 Trillion
key_dates.importance_for_price: Nvidia's market cap milestone reflects strong investor confidence and growth prospects, contributing to stock price appreciation.

key_dates.title: Potential Resumption of H200 Chip Sales to China
key_dates.importance_for_price: Indications of resumed H200 chip sales to China led to a positive market reaction, boosting Nvidia's share price.

key_points.text: Nvidia reported strong Q1 Fiscal 2026 financial results, with significant revenue growth.
The company faced a $4.5 billion charge due to U.S. export controls on H20 products.
Nvidia's market capitalization surpassed $4 trillion, reflecting strong investor confidence.
